Case reference: 2014004348.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1998, Steven Mylan was last seen at his family residence in Mississauga Ontario.  It is believed that Steven might have been headed to New York, and or, Arizona State in the United States of America.

Jacket: Wool, Black, Waist length, Sheep lining

Case reference: 2006028099.CaseDesc: Diane Marie Bourne was last seen on March 6, 1976, at her residence in Ashton, Ontario. Extensive police investigation has failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2014006306.CaseDesc: Shelly Dene was reported missing to the EPS by a family member on November 8, 2013. She had been out of family contact since approximately August 2013. Family is concerned for her welfare as it is unusual for her to be out of contact for this length of time. Shelly resided in Kelowna BC before moving to Edmonton in June 2013.

Case reference: 2014003679.CaseDesc: In December 1983, Konrad Murach was last seen by his family. Since this time, Konrad has not been seen nor has anyone heard from him.

Case reference: 2023070202.CaseDesc: Salman Shuaib was last seen near Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario, early in the evening of December 25, 2023. At the time of his disappearance, Salman was feeling despondent.

InfoSection: White, Blue, Flag, Flag of Israel

Case reference: 2014006142.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2013, at approximately 6:30 a.m., John Lioudakis was seen for the last time at the Toronto Pearson International Airport, in Toronto, Ontario. John flew to Mexico and was scheduled to return on May 31, 2013, but he never boarded the flight.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, On calf; unknown animal

Case reference: 2014004044.CaseDesc: Thomas Buck left his residence in St. Catherine's, Ontario, at 9am on May 30,1993. His vehicle was later located abandoned in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002848.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1981, Daniel McKenzie was seen for the last time. Daniel was reported missing after he was seen leaving a taxi, and running into the wilderness along the Quebec and Labrador border.

Case reference: 2020011471.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1975, at approximately 9:00 am, Stella Zayats was last seen by her husband as she left her residence to go for a walk in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2011005499.CaseDesc: Lukas was last seen on October 3, 2011, heading into the bushes behind Chomista Trailer park. His duffle bag was located in the bushes with his personal property on October 7, 2011. He was en route to his sister's place, but never arrived. Lukas has ties to Winnipeg and Calgary.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2021022793.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2021, Thomas Grise was seen for the last time at a family members residence in Sturgeon Lake Cree Nation, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001046.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1990, the body of this middle-aged man was found on Gore Avenue in Vancouver, British Columbia. He died of complications related to chronic alcohol dependence.

Hair: Blonde, Long dark blonde hair with greying beard
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Young Life Creator brand
Shoes: Grey, Nike Air brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2019000913.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2019, Daniel Hill was seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2014004910.CaseDesc: In 2002, Suppiah Dillirajah was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Suppiah had not been seen for five years.

Case reference: 2016045557.CaseDesc: In January 2015, Warner Huckerby was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002297.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1983, Dean Martin was seen for the last time at a cottage on Mount Carleton in Carleton-sur-Mer, Quebec. He left the cottage without leaving a note or informing anyone. Dean has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2022040012.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2022, Joseph Aldonia Chiasson was seen for the last time by his loved ones in the Shippagan region in New Brunswick. There have been unconfirmed reports he was seen in the Lamèque, NB area on August 12, 2022.

Deformity: Right Leg, Limps on Right leg

Case reference: 2008018099.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1974, at approximately 8:15 hours, Douglas Henderson and Alexander Korecki were canoeing in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe close to the shore in the area of Depot Harbor, Big Sound, in Georgian Bay. The canoe capsized approximately 500 feet away from the campsite.

Case reference: 2020011478.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1988, Mary McCarthy was seen for the last time at her apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Mary’s vehicle was later found on November 17, 1988 at the bus depot in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Mary was a chartered accountant working for CSA Management Ltd. at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2016018567.CaseDesc: Mekayla was last seen at the STC Bus Depot in Yorkton at 1:45 p.m. on April 12, 2016. She went to school in the morning, but left shortly after arriving. She went to several businesses in Yorkton throughout the morning, then returned to school around noon. She bought lunch at the restaurant in the bus depot, but did not get on a bus that day. Mekayla left the bus depot in the early afternoon and hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002434.CaseDesc: On June 25, 1979, Lorraine Legault was seen for the last time as she played in front of the home of her grandparents in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2017015824.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2017, Hua Guo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004872.CaseDesc: Andre Lemieux was last seen on January 9, 2007 in Montreal. He brought his child to daycare and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2017074201.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1995, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in Lake Ontario, near Cherry Beach, in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he may be of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2014002300.CaseDesc: Steven Thomas MacLaren was reported missing when he failed to show up at work on July  11, 1981.  When last spoken to, he had planned on going hiking in Kananaskis Provincial Park. It is believed he was last seen on June 29, 1981.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2016059696.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2016, at approximately 1:00 a.m., Michelle Byron was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Other, WINTER, Dark coloured winter coat

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2020014650.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1919, at approximately 5:30pm, Ambrose Small was seen for the last time with his lawyer in his office at the Grand Opera House in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Other, Dark colour with velvet collar

Case reference: 2023001782.CaseDesc: Félicien Laforce was last seen in November 2022 in the city of Longueuil, Québec, at the intersection of Chambly Road and Vauquelin Boulevard. It's known that Félicien likes to walk in parks and other green areas, as well as using public transportation. Cognitive deterioration appears to be plaguing him. For his safety and well-being, there are grounds for concern.

Coat: Black, Black winter jacket with white logo patch on the left shoulder
Black, Black winter jacket with fur on the hood

Case reference: 2016058794.CaseDesc: Raymond Raine was reported missing in 2016 after family members had not heard from him in several years. Raymond has ties to Maskwacis, Alberta, but was last known to be in the Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta area.

Scar: Left Forearm, 2 inch stab wound scar

Case reference: 2014006149.CaseDesc: On February 7, 1971,  Selina Wallace spent the day with family and friends socializing. In the evening, Selina and friends went to a pier near the family home. The family last saw Selina on the pier with a male friend. When Selina did not return home the following day, family and community members searched the nearby area. The tidal currents near the pier are extremely strong and any person in the water could travel a great distance in a short period of time.

Scar: Right Hand, Circular scar under right thumb, outside of hand

Case reference: 2018005318.CaseDesc: In November 2016 Fereydoun Taleshpour Bandari left his apartment in the Carlton Street and Church Street area of Toronto, to travel.  It is believed Mr. Taleshpour Bandari was sick at the time he left his home.  All of his belongings were left in the apartment and his family cannot account for his whereabouts.

Hair: Black, Short, Straight, Black moustache and beard

Case reference: 2020008535.CaseDesc: On March 6, 1991, at approximately 1:00pm, Martin Stocker was last seen at his retirement home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006016199.CaseDesc: Erich Striewski left Canada in his sailboat "Rochelle."  He was last seen in Aruba, stocking up with supplies. He left Aruba on February 12, 1992, and intended to sail to Panama. Neither Mr. Striewski or his boat have been seen since that time.

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2012020130.CaseDesc:
Mario Marabella, 40 years old, was on his way to a meeting when he was abducted on December 4, 2008 in Laval, Quebec.  Mario was at a Petro-Canada service station on Highway 440 between highways 19 and 25 around 4:00 p.m. when three people forced him into a van and fled. 

Mario's car, a grey Acura MDX, was retrieved around 8:00 p.m. that evening by one or more of the abductors at the same Petro-Canada station from which he was abducted. A few hours later the car was found burning at the corner of Gouin Boulevard and Lambert St. in Montréal, Quebec.  Mario was linked to the Italian Mafia and was known to be involved in organized crime.

Deformity: Abdomen, excess skin due to weigh lost
Scar: Abdomen, operation on abdomen for weight loss

Case reference: 2014005899.CaseDesc: Karen Gilbert left her home in Quebec City on October 7, 2012, at some point during the night. She was subsequently dropped off by taxi in the vicinity of the Montmorency Falls. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2008008198.CaseDesc: Gerald Hart was last seen at around midnight on Christmas Eve on Symmes St, travelling on foot towards Main St in the City of Niagara Falls (the casino district).  Mr. Hart was reported to have been in an intoxicated state.

Case reference: 2014004707.CaseDesc: On June 17, 1986, Paul Leduc was going to the family cottage at Lake Duhamel in the Saint Jovite, Mont Tremblant area. He has not been seen since. His vehicle and personal belongings were found at the cottage. His canoe containing paddles and a life jacket was found adrift on the lake near the cottage.

Case reference: 2014006619.CaseDesc: On November 5, 2008, Colo Flannel was seen for the last time as he left the Intervalle Centre in the Longue-Pointe District in Montreal, Quebec. Colo suffers from a paranoid personality disorder, and may have possibly returned to Haiti.

Case reference: 2014002936.CaseDesc: On February 3, 1988, David Ambroise, then 3 years old, was playing near the Saint-Maurice River in the First Nations reserve of Wemotaci. David approached too close to the water, slipped and fell in. He was then swept away by the current, and has never been found despite searches.

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2014005453.CaseDesc: On December 9, 2004, Sheila Adamo was seen for the last time when she left the family residence in Ottawa, Ontario. She is known to travel to the East Coast as well as into the United States.

Case reference: 2005001099.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2004, an unidentified woman was discovered in a red 2004 Toyota Corolla under the Highway 400 Bridge on Highway 401 in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this female to be from the Americas, South Asia, or Mixed Americas.

Case reference: 2020008536.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1982, Heather Newton was last seen after she was discharged from the Queen Street Mental Health Centre in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008015999.CaseDesc: John Zuern was 21 years old when he went missing from the London Psychiatric Hospital in London, Ontario on June 14, 1975.  He did not return to his family home in Guelph, Ontario, and was reported missing by his family. He had been diagnosed as schizophrenic, and he walks with a pronounced limp.  Mr. Zuern's brother reported seeing him in the Bloor & Spadina area of Toronto during the summer of 1980.  He was believed to have been living on the streets at that time.

Hair: Grey, Long, Unkempt; unkempt Beard, Moustache
Deformity: leg, walks with a pronounced limp

Case reference: 2014003406.CaseDesc: Anthony Janvier was last seen at the courthouse in Cold Lake, Alberta on April 8, 1998. He was reported missing by his mother on February 7, 2002. Anthony lived a transient lifestyle which accounts for the 4 year delay in reporting him missing.

Case reference: 2017070923.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2017, Yoseph Birhanu-Baynesagn left his home in the middle of the night. The following day, Yoseph called his cousin from Union Station to let him know that he was coming for a visit. He never made it to his cousin's.

Case reference: 2014004626.CaseDesc: In March of 1975, Barry “Rocky” Fiddler was reported missing by his family when he failed to return home.  It was learned that he was last seen in July of 1975 at a Powwow at the Thunderchild First Nation, Saskatchewan, which is approximately 1.5 hours from Meadow Lake, Saskatchewan.  Investigation and searches have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2021057203.CaseDesc: Liam Askin was reported missing by family on December 10, 2021. He was last seen at the east Banff Park gates on November 15, 2020. Liam has significant mental and physical illnesses. There have been no confirmed footprints of life since.

Case reference: 2014003086.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1997, Maurizio Di Caprio was last seen in Montreal. He left for Chicoutimi or Toronto to bring a vehicle back to Montreal.

Case reference: 2010000299.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2009, Douglas Chong, 62 years of age, called his sister and advised he had attended the Toronto Western Hospital as he had not been feeling well. He advised he had been dehydrated and was sent to Seaton House to recover where he had been for three days and was feeling better. This was the last time anyone has heard from Douglas Chong. He has not retuned to his last known address. Neither Toronto Western Hospital nor Seaton House have any record of Mr. Chong having been there on or about the 3rd of September, 2009. There has been no use of his health or bank cards since September 3, 2009.

Case reference: 2017018201.CaseDesc: Happy Charles, 42 years old, was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan, the evening of April 3rd, 2017. Happy was in frequent contact with her family in La Ronge, Saskatchewan, and had plans to seek treatment for drug addiction.

Jacket: Leather, Black, worn under long wool coat
Black, long wool coat worn over leather jacket
Jewelry: Grey, small silver locket with a picture of son
Pants: Denim, Blue, wears jeans under sweatpants
Purse: light in color with long straps

Case reference: 2014003152.CaseDesc: Sylvain Baril was last seen on May 8, 1999, in Montreal, Quebec.

Tattoo: Chest, Bird on upper left side

Case reference: 2019026482.CaseDesc: Kristofer Couture drove his vehicle from Alberta to the lower mainland in British Columbia to find work and had cut off ties from his family. Kristofer worked construction for a short period of time while living in his vehicle near Maple Ridge, British Columbia. Kristofer also frequented a gym in Burnaby, British Columbia. Kristofer was last seen leaving the Royal Columbian Hospital in New Westminster, British Columbia on January 26, 2019. His unoccupied vehicle was seen the following day parked at the Elk Mountain Trail in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Kristofer was reported missing on May 17, 2019 and his vehicle was found parked at the same location.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020648.CaseDesc: Andrew Wiebe went missing from his residence in Saskatoon, SK on January 11, 1988. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was later located abandoned in the Anglin Lake District, SK.

Case reference: 2006019899.CaseDesc: Frank Uncapher was last seen on Lac Seul on October 21, 1974. He was on a hunting trip.

Case reference: 2013000098.CaseDesc: On September 5, 1974, eight men were on a drilling barge. As they were making no headway against a strong current, it was agreed upon to park the barge for the night. The eight men worked together to park the vessel however one of the legs failed to lower, causing the barge to tip. Donald Bradburn was amongst the men who were thrown from the barge. Despite dragging operations Donald has never been located.

Case reference: 2014004896.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2002, Aiqiu Chen was seen for the last time as she was leaving her brother’s home in Toronto, Ontario. Aiqiu left with all of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014006178.CaseDesc: An investigation revealed that nobody had seen or heard from Alex Klym since the mid 1970's. The family had made attempts to locate Alex, but they were unsuccessful and nobody ever reported that he was missing. Inquiries were made with various government agencies in an attempt to find some evidence of him after the mid 1970's. There is no trace of him. The body of Alex Klym has never been recovered. It is not known what happened to Alex, but foul play cannot be ruled out.

Case reference: 2014003250.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1974, four people left the Whitedog Indian Reserve, Ontario in a 14' Lund boat and were heading for Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. Their intention was to go to Pointe du Bois to pick up supplies and then return to Whitedog. On November 5, 1974, these individuals were reported missing as they had never returned to Whitedog.  It is believed that the boat overturned and everyone drowned. Two bodies were recovered, and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. Searches were conducted by boat and by air but the bodies of Paul Scott and Richard Petawanahqueb were never recovered.  Paul and Richard are presumed dead due to drowning. No foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2014006747.CaseDesc: Jian Ping Li and her 6 month old baby, Xiao Feng Lu, were last seen at their family residence in Brossard, Quebec on April 30, 2014, around 9:40 a.m. When her husband returned, around 2:30 p.m., there was nobody home and the back door was unlocked.  Jian Ping Li's car was still at the residence. She left without her purse, her wallet, her credit card, her cell phone, money, the diaper bag for the baby, the baby stroller and the car seat.

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2006017199.CaseDesc: Mistie Murray was last seen on May 31, 1995, in the Goderich area.

Teeth: Space between her two upper front teeth

Case reference: 1986087920.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1985, Nicole Morin was seen for the last time leaving her apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Nicole had made arrangements to meet her friend in the lobby of their building so they could go swimming in the pool located at the rear of the building. Nicole never appeared in the lobby. Despite an intense search at the time, Nicole has not been found.

Mark: Forehead, Small birthmark on upper right side of forehead

Case reference: 2014005435.CaseDesc: Although it is unconfirmed, acquaintances of Douglas Scott Renz indicate that he may have left the Chilliwack area in early 2009.  Mr. Renz last had contact with friends in the Chilliwack area in February of 2010, they reported him missing that April.

Case reference: 2014005643.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2008, it was reported a boat had capsized in Lake Winnipeg, 15 miles south east of Poplar River between Marchand Point and George Island. The boat left Poplar Point on Oct 20, 2008, to remove buoys from Lake Winnipeg. During the evening, the boat experienced technical difficulties and was unable to continue. Throughout the early morning hours the weather began to worsen, experiencing 10 foot waves, at this time the vessel started to take in water. As a result the boat began to sink. Two of the three passengers were able to make it to Marchand's Point where they were rescued. No foul play is suspected and it is presumed George Donald Everett drowned.

Jacket: Nylon, Black, zippered Bomber style with "Berens River" patch on back

Case reference: 2014005229.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2009 at around 11:00 am, Ronald Hallam was seen for the last time on his property on Prosperity Line road in the municipality of Ashfield-Colborne-Wawanosh, Ontario.

Pants: Brown, Khaki, Light brown work pants

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2012020087.CaseDesc: James Carlson was last seen between 7:00 p.m. and 8:00 p.m. on 5 May 2010 at a local business in Watrous, Saskatchewan. His 1985 Chevrolet Monte Carlo was found nearly 125 kilometres north in a rural area south of Rosthern Sk. Police have yet to locate James.

Hair: Brown, Balding in front , longer in back
Teeth: Visible Missing, Missing Left upper front tooth

Case reference: 2007000199.CaseDesc: Eric Ram was last seen at 9:00 a.m., on October 5, 1991.  He left his residence to go to the local store to buy milk and a paper and never returned.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Thick brown beard, moustache
Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2006017399.CaseDesc: Mary Frances Gregory left her home in Parry Sound, Ontario on February 15, 1978, to vacation in California. She failed to arrive at her destination in Palo Alto, California and has not contacted any family members or friends since. Ms. Gregory is believed to have departed Canada by motor vehicle with a male acquaintance who states that he let her off at a bus station in Las Vegas, Nevada some ten days after leaving Canada. The driver claims to have driven to Nevada via the States of New York, Pennsylvania, Ohio, Illinois, Colorado, Utah, and Arizona.

Mark: Right Abdomen, Brown, in shape of 5 cent piece (10mm)

Case reference: 2014004485.CaseDesc: Pablo Guerra was reported missing by his family on May 10, 2004. He had no health issues. Pablo's jacket was located in a body of water under the Second Narrows Bridge by Vancouver City Police Marine Section the day Pablo was last seen.

Jacket: Black, North Face embroidered on left breast

Case reference: 2014004721.CaseDesc: Belinda Gertrude Williams was last seen by her sister and father in July 1976 in Vancouver. Ms. Williams was not reported missing until February 2004 to the Stl'Atl'lmx Tribal Police in Mt. Currie, BC.  Stl'Atl'lmx Tribal Police determined that Ms. Williams was last seen in Mission, BC.

Scar: Eyes, Below eye, unknown which eye

Case reference: 2013000139.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Clayton Condos. He was last seen on March 20, 2006, in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

Case reference: 2019068219.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2019, Marshal Iwaasa was last seen by his family in Lethbridge, Alberta. During this time, Marshal had told his family that he was returning to Calgary, Alberta. On November 23, his burnt vehicle was recovered at the end of Phelix Creek Forest Service Road, in a remote area near the Birkenhead Lake Provincial Park in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006019599.CaseDesc: Frank Szpak left his residence on September 23, 1996. He indicated he was going to pick blueberries and never returned. Mr. Szpak suffered from Alzheimer's Disease.

Hat: Blue, Baseball cap with "Motorola" on the front

Case reference: 1999000026.CaseDesc: On Oct 15, 1997, Jami Furnandiz was last seen in the town of Port Perry, Ontario, after dropping her child off to day care. She was scheduled to attend school in the area but did not show up and has not been seen since. Jami Furnandiz frequented the Oshawa downtown and was known to hitchhike by means of traveling between cities.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, red heart with arrow through it

Case reference: 2006007899.CaseDesc: Edward Michael Krantz was last seen on August 23, 1975. He paddled alone into Lake Huron to go fishing, in a 17 foot aluminium MICHI Craft canoe, serial MCC11799M74JF7. Mr. Krantz and the canoe have never been located.

Pants: Orange, Red, white and blue striped pants
Socks: White, Knee high, yellow top stripe
Scar: Lower Back, 25 inch vertical scar from surgery

Case reference: 2014002718.CaseDesc: Wayne Robinson was last seen on October 8, 1985, running away from his school in God's Lake, Manitoba. It is unclear what prompted Wayne to leave school during the recess period. An extensive air, water and land search was conducted with no success.

Case reference: 2019081392.CaseDesc: Casey Badger was last seen leaving his home in Edmonton, Alberta, on January 28, 2020. He was travelling on foot and wrapped in a blanket.

Scar: Right Forearm, Multiple scars on right forearm
Tattoo: Left Chest, Psalms 23 on left chest
Left Cheek, Cross on left cheek

Case reference: 2014002983.CaseDesc: On the 14th of June, 1986, Joseph MAJOR, 75 years old, was reported missing from a care home in the Hudson Bay district, SK. Extensive ground searches of the area failed to locate Joseph.

Case reference: 2018012254.CaseDesc: On March 5, 2018, at approximately 10:50am, Mary Owusu was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Blue, Parka with a fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2014002260.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1993, William Kacuiba was operating a snowmobile on the North Saskatchewan River near Prince Albert, Saskatchewan. He and his snowmobile went through open ice and subsequent searches of the water and area, including air searches, failed to locate William.

Pants: Black, Snowmobile; possible yellow stripe down the sides
Scar: Left Hand, 1.5 cm scar on back of 2nd and 3rd finger
Left Wrist, 2 cm scar on the back of the wrist

Case reference: 2017009362.CaseDesc: Badri Prasad Bhattarai, was reported missing on February 21, 2017, after his family became concerned that he had not been in contact with them. It is believed that his last known location was in the area of the Walterdale Bridge in Edmonton, Alberta. Badri’s disappearance is out of character, and as a result, there are concerns for his well-being.

Chain: Black, Volkswagen Key Fob, House, Locker and mailbox keys
Key Ring with the letter "R" and a Swedish Flag
Ring: Gold, With 3 small clear stones worn on the left ring finger
Scar: Black dots, diabetes scars on both shins

Case reference: 2018041276.CaseDesc:
John Russell Kenny, originally from Ontario, resided without a fixed address in Vancouver, British Columbia. 
Mr. Kenny was known for travelling by train.

Case reference: 2014005195.CaseDesc: Tommy Charpentier worked on a farm and lived with his employer in Sainte-Brigitte-des-Saults. On the night of December 15, 2008, tracks in the snow indicate that he may have walked on the Nicolet River that passes in front of the farm. Mr. Charpentier’s clothes were found on the frozen surface of the river, near an opening in the ice. This suggests that Mr. Charpentier may have jumped into the icy waters of the Nicolet River.

Scar: Ears, Right ear piercing without earring.
Chest, Left nipple piercing without a ring
